jparsec.io.image

Class FitsIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.image.FitsIO

  • public class FitsIO
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to read and write .fits files.

    The data array used for input and output is modified respect to the original .fits format. The new format is the standard (x, y) coordinate system for the first [...][] and second [][...] dimensions in the array. Position (0, 0) of the array is the top left corner of the image (the center of the first pixel), while the (width-1, height-1) is the bottom right corner. For the position of the sources solved by SExtractor the center of the first pixel is at (1, 1).

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      • getDataAsDoubleArray

        public double[][] getDataAsDoubleArray(int n,
                              int max)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Returns the image data as an array of type double.
        Parameters:
        n - The plain.
        max - Offset of the minimum value respect the BZERO value included in the header. Set to -1 to compute it automatically, and to 0 to recover the data you entered in case setData(Object, int, double, double) was called. The adequate value depends on the criteria used to store the image.
        Returns:
        The data.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getData

        public java.lang.Object getData(int n,
                       int x0,
                       int xf,
                       int y0,
                       int yf)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Returns the image data as an array, for a given rectangle.
        Parameters:
        n - The plain.
        x0 - The x index (horizontal position) of the first pixel, 0 is first.
        xf - The x index (horizontal position) of the last pixel in the rectangle.
        y0 - The y index (vertical position) of the first pixel, 0 is first.
        yf - The y index (vertical position) of the first pixel in the rectangle.
        Returns:
        The data.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • setData

        public void setData(java.lang.Object data,
           int n,
           double bzero,
           double bscale)
             throws JPARSECException
        Sets the image data.
        Parameters:
        data - The data.
        n - The plain.
        bzero - The new bzero value. This value is expressed respect the 0-level used internally to represent the lowest intensity. This value is usually -2^(Math.abs(bitpix)-1). In case you set bzero to 0, first intensity will be -2^(Math.abs(bitpix)-1). To obtain 0 as lowest intensity, set bzero to +2^(Math.abs(bitpix)-1).
        bscale - The new bscale value. To conserve the scale set this to 1.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getScaledData

      • createHDU

        public static nom.tam.fits.BasicHDU createHDU(java.lang.Object data,
                              ImageHeaderElement[] header)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Creates a simple fits HDU.
        Parameters:
        data - The data. The raw values are modified considering the BZERO and BSCALE in the provided header. You may want to call after setData(Object, int, double, double), providing the values 0 for BZERO and 1 for BSCALE, so that the raw values are conserved.
        header - The header, or null to set no one.
        Returns:
        The HDU.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        Parameters:

      • solveSources

        public SExtractor solveSources(int n,
                      int minArea,
                      int sigma)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Launches SExtractor tool and retrieve the results of solving the sources in the current image. SExtractor is launched using the settings contained in the header, or with its default settings if those settings are not found. The minimum detection area is set to 3 pixels, and the threshold (sigma) to 5.
        Parameters:
        n - The HDU index to process.
        minArea - The minimum number of pixels above sigma to consider a source as detected. Set it between 3 and 10 depending on how sensitive you want the source detection algorithm to be.
        sigma - How much times the pixels should be above the background emission to consider a source as detected. Set it between 5 and 10.
        Returns:
        The instance with the results.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
